decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of the original permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans - drawing numbers: 20-029-E01 Existing OS Plan, 20-029-E02 Existing Site - Ground Floor Plan, 20-029-E03 Existing Site - First Floor Plan, 20-029-E04 Existing Roof Plan, 20-029-E05 Existing Street Elevation (Madeley Road), 20-029-E06 Existing Front Elevation (North Facing), 20-029-E07 Existing Side Elevation (East Facing), 20-029-P01 Proposed OS Plan, 20-029-P02 Proposed Site - Ground Floor Plan, 20-029-P03 Proposed Site - First Floor Plan, 20-029-P04 Proposed Roof Plan, 20-029-P05 Proposed Street Elevation (Madeley Road), 20-029-P06 Proposed Front Elevation (North Facing), 20-029-P07 Proposed Side Elevation (East Facing), Planning, Design & Access Statement prepared by Red & White dated August 2020, Cover Letter prepared by Red & White dated 16 April 2021.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the building hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details of application ref: PP/2013/0342 dated 01.05.2013.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no works or development shall be carried out.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7A, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4, D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | The refuse and recycling store shown on the approved drawing 791_44-46pln_002 Rev A shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter retained.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D4 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | The Arboricultural report and method statement shall be in accordance with the approved details of application ref: PP/2013/0793 dated 01/05/2013. The development shall thereafter be carried out only in accordance with the approved method statement which shall apply until the end of the construction period.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G7 and SI1 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Details of the approved obscure glazing to be used in, and means of fixing shut, the window in the first floor en-suite shall be in accordance with the approved details of application ref: PP/2013/0446 dated 11.06.2013 and thereafter retained.

Reason: To minimise overlooking and interference with the privacy of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall be Conservation Grade, shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to allow changes on the design, in pursuant to planning permission reference PP/2011/4954 (APP/A5270/A/12/2176376) dated 15/10/2012 for 'Construction of a detached two storey 2-bedroom house with on-site car parking, refuse and recycling storage area and associated landscaping (following demolition of existing structures)'.
